How Israel tracked down and assassinated scientists involved in Iran's nuclear program
description: Israel's attacks in June killed 16 leading researchers involved in Iran's efforts to develop an atomic bomb. Some of them had been under Israeli intelligence surveillance for two decades. With their deaths, Israel believes it has dealt the most decisive blow yet to Tehran's military nuclear program.

headline: Macron calls for new era of Franco-British unity in address to UK Parliament
Texas floods: Over 160 people still listed as missing
In China, a 'black decade' for human rights lawyers
description: On July 9, 2015, Chinese authorities launched a sweeping crackdown on lawyers who dared to defend critics of the regime. 10 years later, the legal profession's room for maneuver has never been narrower.

headline: Germany's federal government and royal family end a century-old dispute
description: An agreement has been reached regarding property confiscated from the Hohenzollern family: Items currently displayed in museums will remain there, while contested objects will be housed at a special foundation.

headline: Spain's Costa Blanca bears the scars of a real estate frenzy
description: The region of Valencia in Spain suffered particularly from the real estate frenzy that led to the 2008 financial crisis. Between 2020 and 2021, the Basque photographer Markel Redondo explored this stretch of the Mediterranean coast, which is now rimmed with concrete. His photographs capture the scars that remain from a short-sighted vision of progress.

headline: France will lend Bayeux Tapestry to the UK, Macron announces
description: While local authorities hailed the decision, conservators warned of the risks of moving such a fragile work across the Channel.

description: Donald Trump welcomed the Israeli prime minister to the White House on Monday, as indirect negotiations between Israel and Hamas are taking place in Doha.
byline: Gilles Paris,  Hélène Sallon and  Isabelle Mandraud

headline: Channel crossings by migrants in small boats are on the rise
description: Since the beginning of the year, more than 20,000 men, women and children have managed to reach the United Kingdom – 7,000 more than during the same period in 2024. At least 15 people have died while attempting the crossing.

headline: Frontex unlawfully shared thousands of people's personal data with European police
description: In the name of combating migrant smugglers, the European Union's border surveillance agency spent years collecting information on migrants and civil society activists deemed 'suspect,' before passing it on to Europol, the EU police cooperation agency.
byline: Apostolis Fotiadis,  Lola Hierro and  Ludek Stavinoha
